piskorski.util.mapping

Class StaticCharToIntMap

  • java.lang.Object
    • piskorski.util.mapping.StaticCharToIntMap

  • public final class StaticCharToIntMap
extends java.lang.Object
    This class implements a static map for mapping characters to integers. The mapping is created based on an array of unique characters. If the characters are not unique the behavior is non deterministic.
    Author:
    Jakub Piskorski

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static int UNDEFINED 

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      static StaticCharToIntMap createInstance(char[] charList)
      Create a static map from characters to integers, where the integers correspond to the position of the characters in the input array of chars, i.e., char[i] = a THEN Map(a) = i.
      static StaticCharToIntMap createrInstance(char[] charList, int[] intList)
      Create a static map from characters to integers, where each character is mapped to an integer in the corresponding position in the input array, i.e., Map(charList[i]) = intList[i].
      int getInt(char c)
      Returns an integer to which an input character maps or StaticCharToIntMap.UNDEFINED otherwise

      • Methods inherited from class java.lang.Object

        clone, equals, finalize, getClass, hashCode, notify, notifyAll, toString, wait, wait, wait

    • Field Detail

      • UNDEFINED

        public static int UNDEFINED

    • Method Detail

      • getInt

        public int getInt(char c)
        Returns an integer to which an input character maps or StaticCharToIntMap.UNDEFINED otherwise
        Parameters:
        c - input character
        Returns:
        integer to which the input character maps or StaticCharToIntMap.UNDEFINED value otherwise.

      • createInstance

        public static StaticCharToIntMap createInstance(char[] charList)
        Create a static map from characters to integers, where the integers correspond to the position of the characters in the input array of chars, i.e., char[i] = a THEN Map(a) = i. The list of input characters has to contain unique characters. If this requirement is not met the behavior of this method is non deterministic.
        Parameters:
        charList - input array consisting of unique characters
        Returns:
        A StaticCharToIntMap object representing the mapping or null in case the arguments are invalid

      • createrInstance

        public static StaticCharToIntMap createrInstance(char[] charList,
                                                 int[] intList)
        Create a static map from characters to integers, where each character is mapped to an integer in the corresponding position in the input array, i.e., Map(charList[i]) = intList[i]. The list of input characters has to contain unique characters. If this requirement is not met the behavior of this method is non deterministic.
        Parameters:
        charList - input array consisting of unique characters
        intList - input array consisting of integers corresponding to the characters
        Returns:
        A StaticCharToIntMap object representing the mapping or null in case the arguments are invalid
